definitions.definition: ( Ireland , UK ) High in price; expensive .
examples: The dearer the jewel, the greater the love expressed.
Such dear embrace tenderly comforts even in this dear sorrow.

definitions.definition: Precious to or greatly valued by someone.
examples: The dearer the giver, the dearer the trinket he brings!

definitions.definition: A formal way to start (possibly after my ) addressing somebody at the beginning of a letter, memo etc.
examples: Dear Sir/Madam/Miss, please notice our offices will be closed during the following bank holidays: [ … ] .

definitions.definition: A formal way to start (often after my ) addressing somebody one likes or regards kindly.
examples: My dear friend, I feel better as soon as you come sit beside my sickbed!

definitions.definition: An ironic way to start (often after my ) addressing an inferior or someone one dislikes.
examples: My dear man, you ought to think twice about who you're trying to blackmail.

main_definition: ( Ireland , UK ) High in price; expensive .
secondary_definitions: Precious to or greatly valued by someone.
A formal way to start (possibly after my ) addressing somebody at the beginning of a letter, memo etc.
A formal way to start (often after my ) addressing somebody one likes or regards kindly.
An ironic way to start (often after my ) addressing an inferior or someone one dislikes.

examples: The Christens found the heathens dear , as the lion doth the bear.
